summary: The Saving Privacy Act aims to amend the Right to Financial Privacy Act of 1978, tightening warrant requirements and exceptions. It also addresses the Consolidated Audit Trail, aiming for its termination and prohibiting the collection of personally identifiable information without specific legislation. Furthermore, it prohibits the issuance of a central bank digital currency and introduces measures for congressional review of agency rulemaking, including the REINS Act. Additional provisions cover suspicious activity penalties, repeal of reporting requirements on third-party network transactions and restrictions on the use of convertible virtual currency.
